summary: This bill, the "Protect Our Law enforcement with Immigration Control and Enforcement Act of 2025" (POLICE Act of 2025), makes the assault of a law enforcement officer a deportable offense for non-citizens. It amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to include this provision, defining the circumstances under which the assault occurs, and defines "law enforcement officer." The bill also mandates an annual report from the Secretary of Homeland Security to Congress on the number of aliens deported under this new provision.
